item.title: NO FILTER: Can Armie Hammer still get away with saying whatever wants?
item.description:
www.sfgate.com
WASHINGTON - Armie Hammer is sitting in a hotel room, in the middle of telling a story, when his publicist coughs. Loudly. Hammer stops talking and turns to look at her. "What?" he asks, grinning innocently. "What?" He's not sharing a particularly controversial anecdote - it's one he told before on "Conan," about how he got so worn down during the 14-month press tour for "Call Me By Your Name" that he refused to wear anything but tracksuits. But the cough may be a signal for "Armie, please stop talking." Or "Armie, please don't say anything that will make my job harder." The need for a signal wouldn't be a surprise.
